00054 // If this system uses pthread based threads, then define
00055 //   dbMutex(), dbThread(), dbLocalEvent(), etc as pthread-based implemenations

00063 
00064 class dbMutex { 
00065     friend class dbLocalEvent;
00066     friend class dbLocalSemaphore;
00067     pthread_mutex_t cs;
00068     bool            initialized;
00069   public:
00070     dbMutex() {
00071 #ifdef NDEBUG
00072         pthread_mutex_init(&cs, NULL);
00073 #else
00074 #ifdef VXWORKS
00075         memset(&cs, '\0', sizeof(cs));
00076 #endif // VXWORKS
00077         int rc = pthread_mutex_init(&cs, NULL);
00078         assert(rc == 0);
00079 #endif
00080         initialized = true;
00081     }
00082     ~dbMutex() {
00083 #ifdef NDEBUG
00084         pthread_mutex_destroy(&cs);
00085 #else
00086         int rc = pthread_mutex_destroy(&cs);
00087         assert(rc == 0);
00088 #endif
00089         initialized = false;
00090     }
00091     bool isInitialized() { 
00092         return initialized;
00093     }
00094     void lock() {
00095         if (initialized) { 
00096 #ifdef NDEBUG
00097             pthread_mutex_lock(&cs);
00098 #else
00099             int rc = pthread_mutex_lock(&cs);
00100             assert(rc == 0);
00101 #endif
00102         }
00103     }
00104     void unlock() {
00105         if (initialized) { 
00106 #ifdef NDEBUG
00107             pthread_mutex_unlock(&cs);
00108 #else
00109             int rc = pthread_mutex_unlock(&cs);
00110             assert(rc == 0);
00111 #endif
00112         }
00113     }
00114 };
00115 
00116 
00117 const size_t dbThreadStackSize = 1024*1024;
00118 
00119 class dbThread { 
00120     pthread_t thread;
00121   public:
00122     typedef void (thread_proc* thread_proc_t)(void*);
00123     
00124     static void sleep(time_t sec) { 
00125         ::sleep(sec);
00126     }
00127 
00128     void create(thread_proc_t f, void* arg) {
00129         pthread_attr_t attr;
00130         pthread_attr_init(&attr);
00131 #if !defined(__linux__)
00132         pthread_attr_setstacksize(&attr, dbThreadStackSize);
00133 #endif
00134 #if defined(_AIX41)
00135         // At AIX 4.1, 4.2 threads are by default created detached
00136         pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&attr, PTHREAD_CREATE_UNDETACHED);
00137 #endif
00138         pthread_create(&thread, &attr, (void*(*)(void*))f, arg);
00139         pthread_attr_destroy(&attr);
00140     }
00141 
00142     void join() { 
00143         void* result;
00144         pthread_join(thread, &result);
00145     }
00146     void detach() { 
00147         pthread_detach(thread);
00148     }
00149 
00150     enum ThreadPriority { 
00151         THR_PRI_LOW, 
00152         THR_PRI_HIGH
00153     };
00154     void setPriority(ThreadPriority pri) { 
00155 #if defined(PRI_OTHER_MIN) && defined(PRI_OTHER_MAX)
00156         struct sched_param sp;
00157         sp.sched_priority = pri == THR_PRI_LOW ? PRI_OTHER_MIN : PRI_OTHER_MAX;
00158         pthread_setschedparam(thread, SCHED_OTHER, &sp); 
00159 #endif
00160     }
00161 
00162     static int getCurrentThreadId() {
00163         return (int)pthread_self();
00164     }
00165 
00166     static int numberOfProcessors();
00167 };

00170 class dbLocalEvent { 
00171     pthread_cond_t   cond;
00172     int              signaled;
00173   public:
00174     void wait(dbMutex& mutex) { 
00175         while (!signaled) { 
00176             pthread_cond_wait(&cond, &mutex.cs);
00177         }
00178     }
00179     bool wait(dbMutex& mutex, time_t timeout) {
00180         if (!signaled) { 
00181             struct timespec abs_ts; 
00182 #ifdef PTHREAD_GET_EXPIRATION_NP
00183             struct timespec rel_ts; 
00184             rel_ts.tv_sec = timeout/1000; 
00185             rel_ts.tv_nsec = timeout%1000*1000000;
00186             pthread_get_expiration_np(&rel_ts, &abs_ts);
00187 #else
00188             struct timeval cur_tv;
00189             gettimeofday(&cur_tv, NULL);
00190             abs_ts.tv_sec = cur_tv.tv_sec + timeout/1000; 
00191             abs_ts.tv_nsec = cur_tv.tv_usec*1000 + timeout%1000*1000000;
00192             if (abs_ts.tv_nsec > 1000000000) { 
00193                 abs_ts.tv_nsec -= 1000000000;
00194                 abs_ts.tv_sec += 1;
00195             }
00196 #endif
00197             do { 
00198                 int rc = pthread_cond_timedwait(&cond, &mutex.cs, &abs_ts);
00199                 if (rc != 0) {
00200                     return false;
00201                 }
00202             } while (!signaled);
00203 
00204         }
00205         return true;
00206     }
00207     void signal() {
00208         signaled = true;
00209         pthread_cond_broadcast(&cond);
00210     }
00211     void reset() {
00212         signaled = false;
00213     }
00214     void open(bool initValue = false) { 
00215         signaled = initValue;
00216         pthread_cond_init(&cond, NULL);
00217     }
00218     void close() {
00219         pthread_cond_destroy(&cond);
00220     }
00221 };
00222 
00223 class dbLocalSemaphore { 
00224     pthread_cond_t   cond;
00225     int              count;
00226   public:
00227     void wait(dbMutex& mutex) { 
00228         while (count == 0) { 
00229             pthread_cond_wait(&cond, &mutex.cs);
00230         }
00231         count -= 1;
00232     }
00233     bool wait(dbMutex& mutex, time_t timeout) {
00234         if (count == 0) { 
00235             struct timespec abs_ts; 
00236 #ifdef PTHREAD_GET_EXPIRATION_NP
00237             struct timespec rel_ts; 
00238             rel_ts.tv_sec = timeout/1000; 
00239             rel_ts.tv_nsec = timeout%1000*1000000;
00240             pthread_get_expiration_np(&rel_ts, &abs_ts);
00241 #else
00242             struct timeval cur_tv;
00243             gettimeofday(&cur_tv, NULL);
00244             abs_ts.tv_sec = cur_tv.tv_sec + timeout/1000; 
00245             abs_ts.tv_nsec = cur_tv.tv_usec*1000 + timeout%1000*1000000;
00246             if (abs_ts.tv_nsec > 1000000000) { 
00247                 abs_ts.tv_nsec -= 1000000000;
00248                 abs_ts.tv_sec += 1;
00249             }
00250 #endif
00251             do { 
00252                 int rc = pthread_cond_timedwait(&cond, &mutex.cs, &abs_ts);
00253                 if (rc != 0) { 
00254                     return false;
00255                 }
00256             } while (count == 0);
00257         }
00258         count -= 1;
00259         return true;
00260     }
00261     void signal(unsigned inc = 1) {
00262         count += inc;
00263         if (inc > 1) { 
00264             pthread_cond_broadcast(&cond);
00265         } else if (inc == 1) { 
00266             pthread_cond_signal(&cond);
00267         }
00268     }
00269     void open(unsigned initValue = 0) { 
00270         pthread_cond_init(&cond, NULL);
00271         count = initValue;
00272     }
00273     void close() {
00274         pthread_cond_destroy(&cond);
00275     }
00276 };
00277 
00278 template<class T> 
00279 class dbThreadContext { 
00280     pthread_key_t key;
00281   public:
00282     T* get() { 
00283         T* p_val = (T*)pthread_getspecific(key);
00284 #ifdef VXWORKS
00285         // HACK - on VXWORKS, setting to NULL releases the key for _all_ threads.
00286         // when windriver defect number WIND00119383 is fixed - this hack may be
00287         // removed.
00288         if (p_val == (T*)-1)
00289             p_val = (T*)NULL;
00290 #endif // VXWORKS
00291         return p_val;
00292     }
00293     void set(T* value) { 
00294 #ifdef VXWORKS
00295         // HACK - on VXWORKS, setting to NULL releases the key for _all_ threads.
00296         // when windriver defect number WIND00119383 is fixed - this hack may be
00297         // removed.
00298         if (value == NULL)
00299             value = (T*)-1;
00300 #endif // VXWORKS
00301         pthread_setspecific(key, value);
00302     }
00303     dbThreadContext() { 
00304         pthread_key_create(&key, NULL);
00305     }
00306     ~dbThreadContext() { 
00307         pthread_key_delete(key);
00308     }
00309 };

00311 class dbProcessId { 
00312     int       pid;
00313     pthread_t tid;
00314   public:
00315     bool operator != (dbProcessId const& other) const { 
00316         return pid != other.pid || tid != other.tid;
00317     }
00318 
00319     void clear() { 
00320         pid = 0;
00321         tid = 0;
00322     }
00323 
00324     static dbProcessId getCurrent() {
00325         dbProcessId curr;
00326         curr.pid = getpid();
00327         curr.tid = pthread_self();
00328         return curr;
00329     }
00330 };

00374     void wait(dbMutex&) {

00376         count -= 1;

00378     void signal(unsigned inc = 1) {
00379         count += inc;
00380     }

00394         return true;

00443 #define INFINITE (~0U)

00446 #ifdef USE_POSIX_SEMAPHORES
00447 
00448 // Initialization Mutex using Posix based semaphores
00449 class dbInitializationMutex { 
00450     sem_t* sem;
00451     char*  name;
00452   public: 
00453     enum initializationStatus { 
00454         InitializationError, 
00455         AlreadyInitialized,
00456         NotYetInitialized
00457     };
00458     initializationStatus initialize(char const* name) { 
00459         initializationStatus status;
00460         this->name = new char[strlen(name)+2];
00461         if (*name != '/') { 
00462             strcpy(this->name+1, name);
00463             *this->name = '/';
00464         } else { 
00465             strcpy(this->name, name);
00466         }
00467         while (true) {
00468             sem = sem_open(this->name, 0);
00469             if (sem == SEM_FAILED) { 
00470                 if (errno == ENOENT) {
00471                     sem = sem_open(this->name, O_CREAT|O_EXCL, 0777, 0);
00472                     if (sem != SEM_FAILED) { 
00473                         status = NotYetInitialized;
00474                         break;
00475                     } else if (errno != EEXIST) { 
00476                         status = InitializationError;
00477                         break;
00478                     }
00479                 } else { 
00480                     status = InitializationError;
00481                     break;
00482                 }
00483             } else { 
00484                 status = (sem_wait(sem) == 0 && sem_post(sem) == 0) 
00485                     ? AlreadyInitialized : InitializationError;
00486                 break;
00487             }
00488         }
00489         return status;
00490     }
00491 
00492     void done() { 
00493         sem_post(sem);
00494     }
00495     bool close() {
00496         sem_close(sem);
00497         return true;
00498     }
00499     void erase() {
00500         sem_unlink(name);
00501         delete[] name;
00502     }
00503 };
00504 
00505 class dbSemaphore { 
00506   protected:
00507     sem_t* sem;
00508     char*  name;
00509   public:
00510     void wait() { 
00511 #ifdef NDEBUG
00512         sem_wait(sem);
00513 #else
00514         int rc = sem_wait(sem);
00515         assert(rc == 0);
00516 #endif
00517     }
00518 
00519     bool wait(unsigned msec) { 
00520 #ifdef POSIX_1003_1d
00521         struct timespec abs_ts;
00522         struct timeval  cur_tv;
00523         clock_gettime(CLOCK_REALTIME, &cur_tv);
00524         abs_ts.tv_sec = cur_tv.tv_sec + (msec + cur_tv.tv_usec / 1000) / 1000000; 
00525         abs_ts.tv_nsec = (msec + cur_tv.tv_usec / 1000) % 1000000 * 1000;
00526         int rc = sem_timedwait(sem, &abs_ts);
00527         if (rc < 0) { 
00528             assert(errno == ETIMEDOUT);
00529             return false;
00530         }
00531         return true;
00532 #else 
00533 #ifdef NDEBUG
00534         sem_wait(sem);
00535 #else
00536         int rc = sem_wait(sem);
00537         assert(rc == 0);
00538 #endif
00539         return true;
00540 #endif  
00541     }
00542 
00543     void signal(unsigned inc = 1) {
00544         while (inc-- > 0) { 
00545             sem_post(sem);
00546         }
00547     }
00548     void reset() { 
00549         while (sem_trywait(sem) == 0);
00550     }    
00551     bool open(char const* name, unsigned initValue = 0) {
00552         this->name = new char[strlen(name)+2];
00553         if (*name != '/') { 
00554             strcpy(this->name+1, name);
00555             *this->name = '/';
00556         } else { 
00557             strcpy(this->name, name);
00558         }
00559         sem = sem_open(this->name, O_CREAT, 0777, initValue);
00560         return sem != NULL; 
00561     }
00562     void close() {
00563         if (sem != NULL) { 
00564             sem_close(sem);
00565             sem = NULL;
00566         }
00567     }
00568     void erase() { 
00569         close();
00570         sem_unlink(name);
00571         delete[] name;
00572     }
00573 };
00574 
00575 class dbEvent : public dbSemaphore { 
00576   public:
00577     void wait() { 
00578         dbSemaphore::wait();
00579         sem_post(sem);
00580     }
00581     bool wait(unsigned msec) { 
00582         if (dbSemaphore::wait(msec)) { 
00583             sem_post(sem);
00584             return true;
00585         }
00586         return false;
00587     }
00588     void signal() {
00589         while (sem_trywait(sem) == 0);
00590         sem_post(sem);
00591     }
00592     void reset() {
00593         while (sem_trywait(sem) == 0);
00594     }
00595     bool open(char const* name, bool signaled = false) {
00596         return dbSemaphore::open(name, (int)signaled);
00597     }
00598 };
00599 #else // USE_POSIX_SEMAPHORES

00651 // Define dbSharedObject and dbSharedMemory
00652 #if defined(USE_POSIX_MMAP) && USE_POSIX_MMAP
00653 
00654 // For POSIX dbSharedObject, we use mmap()
00655 template<class T>
00656 class dbSharedObject { 
00657     char* name;
00658     T*  ptr;
00659     int fd;
00660   public:
00661 
00662     dbSharedObject() { 
00663         name = NULL;
00664         ptr = NULL;
00665         fd = -1;
00666     }
00667 
00668     bool open(char* fileName) { 
00669         delete[] name;
00670         name = new char[strlen(fileName) + 1];
00671         strcpy(name, fileName);
00672         fd = ::open(fileName, O_RDWR|O_CREAT, 0777);
00673         if (fd < 0) { 
00674             return false;
00675         }
00676         if (ftruncate(fd, sizeof(T)) < 0) {
00677             ::close(fd);
00678             return false;
00679         }
00680         ptr = (T*)mmap(NULL,
00681                        DOALIGN(sizeof(T), 4096),
00682                        PROT_READ|PROT_WRITE,
00683                        MAP_SHARED,
00684                        fd,
00685                        0);
00686         if (ptr == MAP_FAILED) { 
00687             ptr = NULL;
00688             ::close(fd);
00689             return false;
00690         }
00691         return true;
00692     }
00693 
00694     T* get() { return ptr; }
00695 
00696     void close() { 
00697         if (ptr != NULL) { 
00698             munmap((char*)ptr, DOALIGN(sizeof(T), 4096));
00699         }
00700         if (fd > 0) { 
00701             ::close(fd);
00702         }
00703     }
00704     void erase() {
00705         close();
00706         unlink(name);   
00707     }  
00708 
00709     ~dbSharedObject() { 
00710         delete[] name;
00711     }
00712 };
00713 
00714 #else // USE_POSIX_MMAP
00715

00717 extern char const* keyFileDir; // default value: "/tmp/"

00721     int    shm;
00722 
00723   public:
00724     bool  open(char const* name, size_t size); 
00725     void  close();
00726     void  erase(); 
00727     char* get_base() { 
00728         return ptr;
00729     }
00730 };

00737     }

00744 // Define dBGlobalCriticalSection for various platforms
00745 
00746 // QNX uses a pthread based mutex for its implementation
00747 //     Use only if pthread support is also enabled, else we'll use the default case
00748 #if defined(__QNX__) && !defined(NO_PTHREADS)
00749 typedef pthread_mutex_t sharedsem_t;
00750 
00751 class dbGlobalCriticalSection { 
00752     pthread_mutexattr_t attr;
00753     sharedsem_t* sem;
00754   public:
00755     void enter() {
00756 #ifdef NDEBUG
00757         pthread_mutex_lock(sem);
00758 #else
00759         int rc = pthread_mutex_lock(sem);
00760         assert(rc == 0);
00761 #endif
00762     }
00763     void leave() { 
00764 #ifdef NDEBUG
00765         pthread_mutex_unlock(sem);
00766 #else
00767         int rc = pthread_mutex_unlock(sem);
00768         assert(rc == 0);
00769 #endif
00770     }
00771     bool open(char const*, sharedsem_t* shr) { 
00772         sem = shr;
00773         return true;
00774     }
00775     bool create(char const*, sharedsem_t* shr) { 
00776         sem = shr;
00777         pthread_mutexattr_init(&attr);
00778         pthread_mutexattr_setpshared(&attr, PTHREAD_PROCESS_SHARED);
00779         pthread_mutexattr_setrecursive(&attr, PTHREAD_RECURSIVE_ENABLE);
00780 #ifdef VXWORKS
00781         memset(&sem, '\0', sizeof(*sem));
00782 #endif // VXWORKS
00783         pthread_mutex_init(sem, &attr);
00784         return true;
00785     }
00786     void close() {}
00787     void erase() {
00788         pthread_mutex_destroy(sem);
00789     }
00790 };
00791 
00792 
00793 #elif defined(__osf__) && !defined(RECOVERABLE_CRITICAL_SECTION)
00794 // OSF uses "shared memory semaphores", located within a region mapped with mmap().
00795 
00796 typedef msemaphore sharedsem_t;
00797 
00798 class dbGlobalCriticalSection { 
00799     sharedsem_t* sem;
00800   public:
00801     void enter() { 
00802         int rc;
00803         while ((rc = msem_lock(sem, 0)) < 0 && errno == EINTR);
00804         assert(rc == 0);
00805     }
00806     void leave() { 
00807         int rc = msem_unlock(sem, 0);
00808         assert(rc == 0);        
00809     }
00810     bool open(char const*, sharedsem_t* shr) { 
00811         sem = shr;
00812         return true;
00813     }
00814     bool create(char const*, sharedsem_t* shr) { 
00815         sem = shr;
00816         msem_init(shr, MSEM_UNLOCKED);
00817         return true;
00818     }
00819     void close() {}
00820     void erase() {
00821         msem_remove(sem);
00822     }
00823 };
00824         
00825 
00826 #elif defined(__sun) && !defined(RECOVERABLE_CRITICAL_SECTION)
00827 // Sun uses the Solaris style semaphore implemenation (sema_init(), sema_post())
00828 
00829 END_FASTDB_NAMESPACE
00830 #include <synch.h>
00831 BEGIN_FASTDB_NAMESPACE
00832  
00833 typedef sema_t sharedsem_t;
00834 
00835 class dbGlobalCriticalSection { 
00836     sharedsem_t* sem;
00837   public:
00838     void enter() { 
00839 #ifdef NDEBUG
00840         while (sema_wait(sem) < 0 && errno == EINTR);
00841 #else
00842         int rc;
00843         while ((rc = sema_wait(sem)) < 0 && errno == EINTR);
00844         assert(rc == 0);
00845 #endif
00846     }
00847     void leave() { 
00848 #ifdef NDEBUG
00849         sema_post(sem);
00850 #else
00851         int rc = sema_post(sem);
00852         assert(rc == 0);
00853 #endif
00854     }
00855     bool open(char const*, sharedsem_t* shr) { 
00856         sem = shr;
00857         return true;
00858     }
00859     bool create(char const*, sharedsem_t* shr) { 
00860         sem = shr;
00861         return sema_init(shr, 1, USYNC_PROCESS, NULL) == 0;
00862     }
00863     void close() {}
00864     void erase() {
00865         sema_destroy(sem);
00866     }
00867 };
00868 
00869 #elif defined(USE_POSIX_SEMAPHORES) && !defined(RECOVERABLE_CRITICAL_SECTION)
00870 // Everyone else uses the POSIX style semaphores (sem_wait(), sem_post(), etc) if defined
00871 typedef sem_t sharedsem_t;
00872 
00873 class dbGlobalCriticalSection { 
00874     sharedsem_t* sem;
00875 
00876   public:
00877     void enter() { 
00878 #ifdef NDEBUG
00879         sem_wait(sem);
00880 #else
00881         int rc = sem_wait(sem);
00882         assert(rc == 0);
00883 #endif
00884     }
00885     void leave() { 
00886 #ifdef NDEBUG
00887         sem_post(sem);
00888 #else
00889         int rc = sem_post(sem);
00890         assert(rc == 0);
00891 #endif
00892     }
00893     bool open(char const* name, sharedsem_t* shr) { 
00894         sem = shr;
00895         return true;
00896     }
00897 
00898     bool create(char const* name, sharedsem_t* shr) {   
00899         sem = shr;
00900         return sem_init(sem, 1, 1) == 0;
00901     }
00902 
00903     void close() {}
00904     void erase() { 
00905         sem_destroy(sem);
00906     }
00907 };
00908 
00909 #else
00910 
00911 #define USE_INTERNAL_CS_IMPL
00912 
00913 #define GLOBAL_CS_DEBUG 1
00914 
00915 // Lastly, use the local implementation
00916 typedef int sharedsem_t;
00917 
00918 class dbGlobalCriticalSection { 
00919     int          semid;
00920     sharedsem_t* count;
00921 #if GLOBAL_CS_DEBUG
00922     pthread_t    owner;
00923 #endif
00924 
00925   public:
00926     void enter(); 
00927     void leave();
00928     bool open(char const* name, sharedsem_t* shr);
00929     bool create(char const* name, sharedsem_t* shr);
00930     void close() {}
00931     void erase();
00932 };
00933 #endif //dbGLobalCriticalSection switch
00934 
00935 END_FASTDB_NAMESPACE
00936 
00937 #endif //__SYNC_UNIX_H__
